title: >>> The FIST of Fury
body_text:
Newbies FARRELL, CRAWFORD Headline 104
Was it the preview of the highly anticipated
Toms River Tournament 2
? Did members of respective teams the
DuckTake Mafia
and silver-medalists
O.R.P. Knights
physically and mentally prepare themselves for what awaits?
Inexperienced young bloods sharing the spotlight, reminiscent of the introduction of
PondScum
icons Lewis and Marzarella at DODGEBALL XXV - sounds all to familiar. But times have changed haven't they and on this 104th spectacular, the die-hard warriors who have entered the state-wide tourny had this final chance to prove themselves worthy of such a stage.
What a coo for the
DuckTape Mafia
to pick up 8th grade all-star Rob Pellecchia. The youngster was red hot all night, eliminating the biggest and the baddest the game has ever seen. Kevin Adams yet again proved to be another formidable opponent, taking down by the masses and scoring several rimshots to his credit. And who could forget about the tenth and final
Knight
, the crafty blocker Justin Wolf. The fearless competitor who first arrived nearly one year ago has returned full-time and to say he hasn't risen up and above the ranks would certainly be an insult to what he has accomplished in such a short period of time.
The captains themselves, still young in their years, also displayed that "never-say-die" attitude, each putting on a tremendous performance. You can bet the dodgeball community has taken notice at some of these fine talents.
In a squash bout, Peter Crawford would go on to defeat Pat Farrell, 6 to 1.
A Return to the Dark ... Almost!
For the second consecutive event, a noticibly large crowd turned to watch the game over two years in the making, the one and only Dodgeball. But in every group, you're bound to find [and dare I say] one ... j*rk-off.
Not even midway through DODGEBALL 104, the lights to the famed Wall High School courts prematurely powered off. A "tough guy" high school student thought it would be amusing to punch the electrical box, tripping the fuse in the process. The initial confusion and revelation of cause immediately altered the moods of the veterans, provoking a war of words between the cowardly lad and Season 1 icon Tom Adams.
For the legends that have held this sport together in its 25 month existence, this was nothing to laugh or joke about. Luckily within a matter of 15 minutes, the bright lights slowly but surely kicked on again and DODGEBALL 104 continued without any further distractions.
Moments & Stars
: Grant Cornero wearing his Starbucks apron; Justin Pierce deflecting an enemy ball into Justin Wolf's groin; three rimshots earned for Kevin Adams and John Tronolone
RECORDS
> Attendance: 24
> Notable Returns: Grant Cornero & Lenny Herrera (Last appearances at DODGEBALL 100)
> New Players: (5) Pat Farrell, Peter Crawford, Olivia Thrall, Robbie Reaves, Mike Fiorentino
- DODGEBALL 104 witnessed the debut of two brand new captains who were also making their dodgeball debuts in Pat Farrell and Peter Crawford.
- In the highly contested war, Peter Crawford picked up the victory over Farrell 6 games to 1.
________________________________________
________________
Toms River Tournament 2
September 22, 2007 at Toms River High School East
DODGEBALL 105
September 29, 2007 at Wall High School

Newbies FARRELL, CRAWFORD Headline 104
Was it the preview of the highly anticipated Toms River Tournament 2? Did members of respective teams the DuckTake Mafia and silver-medalists O.R.P. Knights physically and mentally prepare themselves for what awaits?

Inexperienced young bloods sharing the spotlight, reminiscent of the introduction of PondScum icons Lewis and Marzarella at DODGEBALL XXV - sounds all to familiar. But times have changed haven't they and on this 104th spectacular, the die-hard warriors who have entered the state-wide tourny had this final chance to prove themselves worthy of such a stage.

What a coo for the DuckTape Mafia to pick up 8th grade all-star Rob Pellecchia. The youngster was red hot all night, eliminating the biggest and the baddest the game has ever seen. Kevin Adams yet again proved to be another formidable opponent, taking down by the masses and scoring several rimshots to his credit. And who could forget about the tenth and final Knight, the crafty blocker Justin Wolf. The fearless competitor who first arrived nearly one year ago has returned full-time and to say he hasn't risen up and above the ranks would certainly be an insult to what he has accomplished in such a short period of time.

The captains themselves, still young in their years, also displayed that "never-say-die" attitude, each putting on a tremendous performance. You can bet the dodgeball community has taken notice at some of these fine talents.

In a squash bout, Peter Crawford would go on to defeat Pat Farrell, 6 to 1.

A Return to the Dark ... Almost!
For the second consecutive event, a noticibly large crowd turned to watch the game over two years in the making, the one and only Dodgeball. But in every group, you're bound to find [and dare I say] one ... j*rk-off.

Not even midway through DODGEBALL 104, the lights to the famed Wall High School courts prematurely powered off. A "tough guy" high school student thought it would be amusing to punch the electrical box, tripping the fuse in the process. The initial confusion and revelation of cause immediately altered the moods of the veterans, provoking a war of words between the cowardly lad and Season 1 icon Tom Adams.

For the legends that have held this sport together in its 25 month existence, this was nothing to laugh or joke about. Luckily within a matter of 15 minutes, the bright lights slowly but surely kicked on again and DODGEBALL 104 continued without any further distractions.

> Notable Returns: Grant Cornero & Lenny Herrera (Last appearances at DODGEBALL 100)
> New Players: (5) Pat Farrell, Peter Crawford, Olivia Thrall, Robbie Reaves, Mike Fiorentino

- DODGEBALL 104 witnessed the debut of two brand new captains who were also making their dodgeball debuts in Pat Farrell and Peter Crawford.
- In the highly contested war, Peter Crawford picked up the victory over Farrell 6 games to 1.
